column4: hi, just installed fedora, I am ubuntu users, so now I have ubuntu on one partition and fedora on another, when I boot it goes directly to fedora, how can I choose OS to boot to before starting?
you'll have to reconfigure grub
fedora? any help would be highly appreciated
it doesn't matter that its fedora, you can mount your other parition and reconfiure grub.  The easiest might be to see if fedora has a way to do it.
do you ahve an ubuntu livecd ?
yes
are you using 9.10?
yes
this looks okay.  http://pingusays.blogspot.com/2009/11/reinstalling-grub-in-karmic-koala-910.html
did you try to follow what was written on that page I sent you?
ye4s, did not work, so I removed fedora, now I just want to ue ubuntu
do you know what hard drive you os is on?
I dont' have grub-2 where did it fail for you?
in the guide you gave me I had to use grub, which I did, and now cant boot
right you boot from the live cd and then you run grub-install .
are you at the grub prompt now?
yes
try find /boot/grub/core.img
file not found
try rebooting from the live cd.
when you reboot onto the live cd go to a shel, and check what harddrives you have available say ls /dev/sd*
